message.content:
cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

This paper presents a method for controlling recovery maneuvers of a quadrupedal robot using Deep Reinforcement Learning (RL). The paper focuses on the application of the method to a real system, the quadrupedal robot ANYmal, which is a dog-sized quadrupedal system with 12 degrees of freedom. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.RO (Robotics), which is the primary focus of the paper. 

The paper also extensively uses Deep Reinforcement Learning (RL) to train the controller, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The hierarchical behavior-based controller used in the paper involves coordinating multiple neural network policies, which could also suggest that it belongs to cs.SY (Systems and Control). 

Finally, the paper uses simulation and experimental validation to test the approach, which could also suggest that it belongs to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) as it involves analyzing and interpreting visual data from the robot's sensors.
